TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit BinaryReader extends System.Object implements class System.IDisposable

summary.span: 用特定的编码将基元数据类型读作二进制值。

span.span: Reads primitive data types as binary values in a specific encoding.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 类提供简化从流中读取基元数据类型的方法。The class provides methods that simplify reading primitive data types from a stream. 例如，可以使用 方法将下一个字节作为布尔值读取，并将流中的当前位置提升一个字节。For example, you can use the method to read the next byte as a Boolean value and advance the current position in the stream by one byte. 类包含支持不同数据类型的 read 方法。The class includes read methods that support different data types. 在创建类的新实例时 ，提供从中读取的流，还可以选择指定编码的类型以及是否在释放对象后保持流处于打开状态 。When you create a new instance of the class, you provide the stream to read from, and optionally specify the type of encoding and whether to leave the stream open after disposing the object. 如果未指定编码类型，将使用 UTF-8。If you do not specify an encoding type, UTF-8 is used. > [!IMPORTANT] > 此类型实现 接口。This type implements the interface. 在使用完类型后，您应直接或间接释放类型。When you have finished using the type, you should dispose of it either directly or indirectly. 若要直接释放类型，请在 `try`/`catch` 块中调用其 方法。To dispose of the type directly, call its method in a `try`/`catch` block. 若要间接释放类型，请使用 `using`（在 C# 中）或 `Using`（在 Visual Basic 中）等语言构造。To dispose of it indirectly, use a language construct such as `using` (in C#) or `Using` (in Visual Basic). 有关详细信息，请参阅 接口主题中的“使用实现 IDisposable 的对象”一节。For more information, see the "Using an Object that Implements IDisposable" section in the interface topic. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何在文件中存储和检索应用程序设置。The following code example demonstrates how to store and retrieve application settings in a file. [!code-csharp[System.IO.BinaryReaderWriter#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.IO.BinaryReaderWriter/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.IO.BinaryReaderWriter#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.IO.BinaryReaderWriter/VB/source.vb#1)]

summary.span: 公开对 的基础流的访问。

span.span: Exposes access to the underlying stream of the .
The underlying stream associated with the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks > [!CAUTION] > 在读取或使用时使用基础流 `BinaryReader` 可能会导致数据丢失和损坏。Using the underlying stream while reading or while using the `BinaryReader` can cause data loss and corruption. 例如，可能会多次读取相同的字节，可能会跳过字节或字符读取。For example, the same bytes might be read more than once, bytes might be skipped, or character reading might become unpredictable. 有关常见 i/o 任务的列表，请参阅 [常见 I/o 任务](/dotnet/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks)。For a list of common I/O tasks, see [Common I/O Tasks](/dotnet/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks). ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何使用类的和类，在内存中读取和写入 `Double` 数据 `BinaryReader` 。The following code example shows how to read and write `Double` data to memory by using the `BinaryReader` and classes on top of the class. `MemoryStream` 仅读取和写入 `Byte` 数据。`MemoryStream` only reads and writes `Byte` data. [!code-cpp[System.IO.BinaryReaderWriter.RWDouble#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.IO.BinaryReaderWriter.RWDouble/CPP/rwdouble.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.IO.BinaryReaderWriter.RWDouble#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.IO.BinaryReaderWriter.RWDouble/CS/rwdouble.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.IO.BinaryReaderWriter.RWDouble#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.IO.BinaryReaderWriter.RWDouble/VB/rwdouble.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void Close ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Close() cil managed
Public Overridable Sub Close ()
public: virtual void Close();
abstract member Close : unit -> unit override this.Close : unit -> unit

summary.span: 关闭当前阅读器及基础流。

span.span: Closes the current reader and the underlying stream.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 的这一实现 `Close` 调用 传递值的方法 `true` 。This implementation of `Close` calls the method passing a `true` value. 除非显式调用或，否则刷新流将不会刷新其基础编码器 `Close` 。Flushing the stream will not flush its underlying encoder unless you explicitly call or `Close`. 如果设置为，则 `true` 表示将数据从缓冲区刷新到流，但不会刷新编码器状态。Setting to `true` means that data will be flushed from the buffer to the stream, but the encoder state will not be flushed. 这样，编码器就可以将其状态保留 (部分字符) 以便它能够正确地编码下一个字符块。This allows the encoder to keep its state (partial characters) so that it can encode the next block of characters correctly. 此方案影响 UTF8 和 UTF7，其中某些字符只能在编码器接收到相邻字符后编码。This scenario affects UTF8 and UTF7 where certain characters can only be encoded after the encoder receives the adjacent character or characters.

Public Sub Dispose ()

summary.span: 释放 类的当前实例所使用的所有资源。

span.span: Releases all resources used by the current instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在完成使用 `Dispose` 后，应调用 。Call `Dispose` when you are finished using the . `Dispose` 方法使 处于不可用状态。The `Dispose` method leaves the in an unusable state. 调用后 `Dispose` ，必须释放对的所有引用， 以便垃圾回收器能够回收占用的内存 。After calling `Dispose`, you must release all references to the so the garbage collector can reclaim the memory that the was occupying. 有关详细信息，请参阅 [清理非托管资源](/dotnet/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged) 和 [实现 Dispose 方法](/dotnet/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose)。For more information, see [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](/dotnet/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged) and [Implementing a Dispose Method](/dotnet/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose). > [!NOTE] > 每次释放对 `Dispose` 的最后一个引用前，均应调用 。Always call `Dispose` before you release your last reference to the . 否则，在垃圾回收器调用 对象的 `Finalize` 方法之前，该对象正在使用的资源不会被释放。Otherwise, the resources it is using will not be freed until the garbage collector calls the object's `Finalize` method.

summary.span: 释放 类使用的非托管资源，并可以选择释放托管资源。

span.span: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the class and optionally releases the managed resources.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法由和调用 `Dispose` 。This method is called by `Dispose` and . 默认情况下，此方法将 `disposing` 参数指定为 `true` 。By default, this method specifies the `disposing` parameter as `true`. 指定 `disposing` 参数为 `false` 。 specifies the `disposing` parameter as `false`. 当 `disposing` 参数为 `true` 时，此方法释放该 引用的、由任何托管对象持有的全部资源。When the `disposing` parameter is `true`, this method releases all resources held by any managed objects that this references. 此方法将调用每个被引用对象的 `Dispose` 方法。This method invokes the `Dispose` method of each referenced object.

para.span: 可以由其他对象多次调用。

span.span: can be called multiple times by other objects.

para.span: 重写此方法时，请注意不要引用先前在调用时已释放的对象 。

span.span: When overriding this method, be careful not to reference objects that have been previously disposed of in an earlier call to .

para.span: 有关如何实现此方法的详细信息，请参阅 [实现 Dispose 方法](/dotnet/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose)。

span.span: For more information about how to implement this method, see [Implementing a Dispose Method](/dotnet/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose).

para.span: 有关和的详细 信息 ，请参阅 [清理非托管资源](/dotnet/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged)。

span.span: For more information about and , see [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](/dotnet/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged).

summary.span: 从基础流中读取字符，并根据所使用的 和从流中读取的特定字符，提升流的当前位置。

span.span: Reads characters from the underlying stream and advances the current position of the stream in accordance with the used and the specific character being read from the stream.

returns.span: 输入流中的下一个字符，如果当前无可用字符则为 -1。

span.span: The next character from the input stream, or -1 if no characters are currently available.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 读取失败后不还原文件位置。 does not restore the file position after an unsuccessful read. 有关常见 i/o 任务的列表，请参阅 [常见 I/o 任务](/dotnet/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks)。For a list of common I/O tasks, see [Common I/O Tasks](/dotnet/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks). ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何使用内存作为后备存储来读取和写入数据。The following example shows how to read and write data using memory as a backing store. 此示例显示控制台的无效文件路径字符列表。This example displays a list of invalid file path characters to the console. 尽管代码尝试显示所有无效文件路径字符的列表，但并不是所有字符都在可显示的字符集中。Although the code tries to display a list of all invalid file path characters, not all of the characters are within the displayable set of characters. 因为无效字符的列表可能因系统而异，所以此代码的输出也可能有所不同。Because the list of invalid characters can vary based on the system, output for this code may also vary. [!code-cpp[System.IO.BinaryReaderWriter.RWChar2#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.IO.BinaryReaderWriter.RWChar2/CPP/rwreadchar.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.IO.BinaryReaderWriter.RWChar2#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.IO.BinaryReaderWriter.RWChar2/CS/rwreadchar.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.IO.BinaryReaderWriter.RWChar2#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.IO.BinaryReaderWriter.RWChar2/VB/rwreadchar.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 读操作失败后不会还原文件位置。 does not restore the file position after an unsuccessful read operation. 有关常见 i/o 任务的列表，请参阅 [常见 I/o 任务](/dotnet/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks)。For a list of common I/O tasks, see [Common I/O Tasks](/dotnet/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks). ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何使用内存作为后备存储来编写二进制数据。The following example shows how to write binary data by using memory as a backing store. 它向控制台显示一条消息，指示是否已正确写入数据。It displays a message to the console that indicates whether the data was written correctly. [!code-csharp[System.IO.BinaryReaderWriter.RWBytes2#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.IO.BinaryReaderWriter.RWBytes2/CS/rwreadbytes.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.IO.BinaryReaderWriter.RWBytes2#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.IO.BinaryReaderWriter.RWBytes2/VB/rwreadbytes.vb#1)] 此示例读取文件的内容，并以16列格式显示每个字节的数字值。This example reads the contents of a file and displays each byte's numeric value in 16-column format. 当方法返回零字节时，将检测正在读取的文件的结尾 。The end of the file that is being read is detected when the method returns zero bytes. [!code-csharp[System.IO.BinaryReaderWriter#6](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.IO.BinaryReaderWriter/CS/source5.cs#6)] [!code-vb[System.IO.BinaryReaderWriter#6](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.IO.BinaryReaderWriter/VB/source5.vb#6)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 读操作失败后不会还原文件位置。 does not restore the file position after an unsuccessful read operation. 有关常见 i/o 任务的列表，请参阅 [常见 I/o 任务](/dotnet/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks)。For a list of common I/O tasks, see [Common I/O Tasks](/dotnet/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks). ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何使用内存作为后备存储来读取和写入数据。The following example shows how to read and write data using memory as a backing store. 此示例显示控制台的无效文件路径字符列表。This example displays a list of invalid file path characters to the console. 尽管代码尝试显示所有无效文件路径字符的列表，但并不是所有字符都在可显示的字符集中。Although the code tries to display a list of all invalid file path characters, not all of the characters are within the displayable set of characters. 因为无效字符的列表可能因系统而异，所以此代码的输出也可能有所不同。Because the list of invalid characters can vary based on the system, output for this code may also vary. remarks.format: ## Remarks 读取失败后不还原文件位置。 does not restore the file position after an unsuccessful read. 由于存在数据格式冲突，因此不建议将此方法用于以下编码：Because of data formatting conflicts, using this method with the following encodings is not recommended: - UTF-7UTF-7 - ISO-2022-日本ISO-2022-JP - ISCIIISCII 有关常见 i/o 任务的列表，请参阅 [常见 I/o 任务](/dotnet/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks)。For a list of common I/O tasks, see [Common I/O Tasks](/dotnet/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks). ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何使用内存作为后备存储来编写二进制数据，然后验证是否已正确写入数据。The following code example shows how to write binary data using memory as a backing store, and then verify that the data was written correctly. summary.span: 从当前流中读取下一个字符，并根据所使用的 和从流中读取的特定字符，提升流的当前位置。

span.span: Reads the next character from the current stream and advances the current position of the stream in accordance with the used and the specific character being read from the stream.

returns.span: 从当前流中读取的字符。

span.span: A character read from the current stream.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果该 方法尝试读取流中的代理项字符，则会引发异常，并将提升流中的位置。If the method attempts to read a surrogate character in the stream an exception will be raised and the position in the stream will advance. 如果流可查找，则在调用之前将位置还原到原始位置 ; 但是，如果流为 unseekable，则不会更正位置。The position is restored to the original location before was called if the stream is seekable; however, if the stream is unseekable, the position will not be corrected. 如果流中应有代理项字符，请改用 方法。If surrogate characters can be expected in the stream, use the method instead. 由于存在数据格式冲突，因此不建议将此方法用于以下编码：Because of data formatting conflicts, using this method with the following encodings is not recommended: - UTF-7UTF-7 - ISO-2022-日本ISO-2022-JP - ISCIIISCII 有关常见 i/o 任务的列表，请参阅 [常见 I/o 任务](/dotnet/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks)。For a list of common I/O tasks, see [Common I/O Tasks](/dotnet/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks). ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何使用内存作为后备存储来读取和写入数据。The following code example shows how to read and write data using memory as a backing store. [!code-cpp[System.IO.BinaryReaderWriter.RWChar1#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.IO.BinaryReaderWriter.RWChar1/CPP/rwchar.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.IO.BinaryReaderWriter.RWChar1#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.IO.BinaryReaderWriter.RWChar1/CS/rwchar.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.IO.BinaryReaderWriter.RWChar1#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.IO.BinaryReaderWriter.RWChar1/VB/rwchar.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 读取失败后不还原文件位置。 does not restore the file position after an unsuccessful read. `BinaryReader` 以小字节序格式读取此数据类型。`BinaryReader` reads this data type in little-endian format. 有关常见 i/o 任务的列表，请参阅 [常见 I/o 任务](/dotnet/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks)。For a list of common I/O tasks, see [Common I/O Tasks](/dotnet/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks). ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何使用类的和类，在内存中读取和写入 `Double` 数据 `BinaryReader` 。The following code example shows how to read and write `Double` data to memory by using the `BinaryReader` and classes on top of the class. `MemoryStream` 仅读取和写入 `Byte` 数据。`MemoryStream` only reads and writes `Byte` data. summary.span: 从当前流中读取 2 字节有符号整数，并使流的当前位置提升 2 个字节。

span.span: Reads a 2-byte signed integer from the current stream and advances the current position of the stream by two bytes.

returns.span: 从当前流中读取的 2 字节有符号整数。

span.span: A 2-byte signed integer read from the current stream.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 读取失败后不还原文件位置。 does not restore the file position after an unsuccessful read. `BinaryReader` 以小字节序格式读取此数据类型。`BinaryReader` reads this data type in little-endian format. 有关常见 i/o 任务的列表，请参阅 [常见 I/o 任务](/dotnet/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks)。For a list of common I/O tasks, see [Common I/O Tasks](/dotnet/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks).

span.span: The end of the stream is reached.
The stream is closed.
An I/O error occurred.
File and Stream I/O

summary.span: 从当前流中读取一个字符串。

span.span: Reads a string from the current stream.

summary.span: 字符串有长度前缀，一次 7 位地被编码为整数。

span.span: The string is prefixed with the length, encoded as an integer seven bits at a time.

returns.span: 正被读取的字符串。

span.span: The string being read.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 读取失败后不还原文件位置。 does not restore the file position after an unsuccessful read. 有关常见 i/o 任务的列表，请参阅 [常见 I/o 任务](/dotnet/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks)。For a list of common I/O tasks, see [Common I/O Tasks](/dotnet/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks). ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何在文件中存储和检索应用程序设置。The following code example demonstrates how to store and retrieve application settings in a file. summary.span: 释放由 使用的所有资源。

span.span: Releases all resources used by the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 调用 会允许出于其他目的重新分配所使用的资源 。Calling allows the resources used by the to be reallocated for other purposes. 有关的详细信息 ，请参阅 [清理非托管资源](/dotnet/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged)。For more information about , see [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](/dotnet/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged).
